1.title: Washington Basic Rules Test 1
1.description: Fundamental driving laws and regulations for Washington state

questions.question: What is the speed limit in Washington residential areas unless otherwise posted?
questions.explanation: Washington state law sets residential speed limits at 25 mph unless otherwise posted.

questions.question: In Washington, when must you yield the right-of-way to pedestrians?
options: Only when they have a walk signal
questions.explanation: In Washington, drivers must yield to pedestrians in crosswalks and when making turns.

questions.question: What is the minimum following distance recommended in Washington?
questions.explanation: The 3-second rule provides adequate following distance for normal conditions.

questions.question: In Washington, you cannot park within how many feet of a fire hydrant?
questions.explanation: Washington law requires parking at least 15 feet away from fire hydrants.

questions.question: What should you do when approaching a school bus with flashing red lights?
questions.explanation: When a school bus has flashing red lights, all traffic must stop in both directions.

2.title: Washington Traffic Signs Test 2
2.description: Recognition and understanding of traffic signs specific to Washington

questions.question: What does a octagonal red sign mean?
questions.explanation: An octagonal red sign is always a stop sign, requiring a complete stop.

questions.question: A triangular sign pointing down means:
questions.explanation: Triangular signs pointing down indicate yield - slow down and give right-of-way.

questions.question: Orange construction signs mean:
questions.explanation: Orange signs indicate construction zones and temporary traffic control.

questions.question: A circular sign with a red circle and line means:
questions.explanation: Red circle with diagonal line indicates something is prohibited.

questions.question: Green signs on highways typically indicate:
questions.explanation: Green highway signs provide directional information and distances.

3.title: Washington Parking & Right-of-Way Test 3
3.description: Parking regulations and right-of-way rules for Washington drivers

questions.question: At a 4-way stop, who has the right-of-way?
questions.explanation: At 4-way stops, the first vehicle to arrive and come to a complete stop has the right-of-way.

questions.question: You cannot park within how many feet of a crosswalk?
questions.explanation: Washington prohibits parking within 20 feet of crosswalks to maintain visibility.

questions.question: When making a left turn, yield to:
questions.explanation: Left-turning vehicles must yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.

questions.question: Parallel parking requires you to be within how many inches of the curb?
questions.explanation: When parallel parking, your vehicle should be within 12 inches of the curb.

questions.question: In a roundabout, yield to:
questions.explanation: When entering a roundabout, yield to traffic already circulating inside.
